vocabulary.example: crash [v] - when a computer stops working
an attachment [n] - a file attached to an email

questions.question: What does Marie need help with?
options: She received an email that might have a virus.

questions.question: What is Bob's advice?
options: Restart the computer with a paper clip.
Press the green button to turn it on.
Change the batteries in the mouse.

questions.question: What does Paul need help with?
options: He received an email that might have a virus.

questions.question: What is Bob's advice?
options: Restart the computer with a paper clip.
Press the green button to turn it on.
Change the batteries in the mouse.

questions.question: What does Cheryl need help with?
options: She received an email that might have a virus.

questions.question: What is Bob's advice?
options: Restart the computer with a paper clip.
Press the green button to turn it on.
Change the batteries in the mouse.

grammar.explanation: Choose the grammatically correct word to complete the sentence, focusing on imperatives, modals, or sentence structure. Each question has one correct answer and three incorrect options.

exercises.sentence: ___ the green button on the printer.
Click on the 'No-Virus' icon to ___ the computer.
Stick this here to ___ the computer.
I ___ get any work done with all these questions!

transcript.full:
Marie: Bob, can you help me with something?

Bob: Sure.

Marie: I'm trying to print a file, but the printer won't work.

Bob: Push the green button on the printer.

Marie: Why?

Bob: To turn it on. It won't print unless it's on.

Marie: Oh, right. Silly me. Thank you.

Paul: Hey, Bob. My laptop crashed, and I can't get it to do anything. I type on the keyboard, and nothing happens.

Bob: Stick this here.

Paul: Why?

Bob: To restart the computer.

Paul: You sure? OK. Thanks.

Cheryl: Bob, I could use a hand with something.

Bob: What is it?

Cheryl: Somebody sent me an e-mail, but I think it has a virus in it.

Bob: Don't open the attachment. Click on the No-Virus icon on the toolbar.

Cheryl: Why?

Bob: To clean the computer and stop the virus.

Cheryl: Thanks!

Marie: Bob, can I ask you another question?

Bob: I'm sorry, but I can't get any work done with all these questions! Please. I have some very important stuff I need to finish right now.

Marie: Very important stuff?

Bob: How can I help you?
